title: ExceptionRenderer makes use of AppView, causing an infinite loop when missing a Helper.
body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 3.3.9
* Platform and Target: Vagrant bento/debian-8.6 with PHP7.0.13-1~dotdeb+8.1

### What I did
I created a new project, where I loaded a git submodule into the plugins in order to start updating my TableHelper plugin. The goal of this project was to setup a sandbox to develop plugins.
I loaded the plugin and then added `$this->loadHelper('TableHelper.Table');` to the `initialize()` method of the default `AppView`.

### What happened
My helper wasn't loaded with the following message on the screen:

> An Internal Server Error Occurred

I checked the error.log of Apache, tried to find an error log of PHP but nothing there. After a couple of hours debugging I found out that my php.ini didn't log php errors. So, changed that and went back into the code and tried to find the log file.

Nothing.

So after a tip on Stackoverflow I kept adding `die()` methods in the core of CakePHP and after another couple of hours, I think I found out what is wrong.

### What I think is wrong

I believe the default `ExceptionRenderer` is using the `AppView` as viewClass, right? Now, when I load a helper that doesn't exist, it will try to render an exception. But, that exception renderer is creating a new instance of `AppView` and thus trying to load the non existing helper again, and again, and again...

At first I thought I was wrong, and I still don't believe it actually, but after some more debugging I think I confirmed this.

### Howto reproduce

- Create a new project, make sure you see the default cake page.
- Add `debug($className);` at https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/src/View/ViewBuilder.php#L362
- Refresh the page, as expected you see `AppView` popup.
- Add an Exception somewhere in `AppController::initialize()`.
- Refresh the page, you'll see `AppView` two times, as expected

This confirms AppView is being used by the ExceptionRenderer.

- Remove the Exception from the AppController
- Add `$this->loadHelper('FooBar')` to `AppView::initialize()`.
- Refresh, your page, now you'll see `AppView` three times and then `An Internal Server Error Occurred`

### What you expected to happen
A 500 Exception with a 'Missing Helper' message of some sort.

### Proposed solution
A dedicated 'ExceptionView' which makes sure no programmer input is messing up the view. If I want the ExceptionRenderer to use my own `AppView` I will have to opt-in, instead of opt-out.

#### PS.
The error.log in the logs dir did log the missing Helper message, but I wasn't expecting this `internal server error` message and so I thought something else was wrong. Therefore I had to dig into it as I believed I was making a mistake.

It was also hard to debug as I tested it on another project (also Cake3) but that uses a custom viewClass (but not for the ExceptionRenderer). So when I loaded a non-existing helper there, it wasn't showing this error as the infinite loop wasn't present. Which caused even more of a headache as I wasn't expecting this simple bug.
